page.title: 05ECOLOGY NEAR POYNTINGTON 2
page.content: Wildlife flourishes in this area of low population and benign climate. {Animals & birds:}badgers,foxes,moles are common,favouring the friable Yeovil Sands for their burrows.Roe and fallow deer roam in small groups. Buzzards and kestrels frequent the hills.Rooks,jackdaws and herons are also common.Butterflies include Brimstone,Red Admiral,Peacock,Orange Tip,Large and Small White, Tortoiseshells and others. {Wild Flowers:}Primroses,bluebells,cow parsely and other umbellifers,red campion,lords and ladies grow on road verges;marsh orchids,lady's smock and kingcups in valleys;ragwort on poorer pastures.{Trees:}mostly few and scattered;mainly ash,sycamore,elder, hawthorne,scots pine,sweet chestnut, oak and some beech
